TITLE.P: Partnership Framework Agreement for Carers Support

SHORT_DESCR.P: Milton Keynes Council intends to procure a strategic partner to help develop and deliver support services for carers.

Following a review of national requirements for carers support, coupled with local service provision and pathways, Milton Keynes Council has decided to enter into a partnership Framework Agreement for carers support. A contract will be in place from 1.10.2019. We are seeking expressions of interest from potential providers prior to potentially entering into formal procurement arrangements. This contract is likely to be for 5 years, with an option to extend for up to a further 2 years, making a maximum of 7 years in total. Any annual extension will be agreed between the Council and the provider.

INFO_ADD.P: MKC reserves the right to award without further competition (where there is only one satisfactory expression of interest). Only those that have submitted an EOI may be invited to any further tender stage(s). Any contract(s) awarded in respect of this procurement will be awarded without further publication.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: EOI questions are to establish if a provider is capable of delivering the service. MKC reserve the right to award without further competition (where there is only one satisfactory expression of interest). However, if more than one bidder who is capable of delivering the service applies, a full competitive tender process will be carried out and bidders will answer additional MEAT questions, as part of this process.

INFO_ADD.P: The following Contracting Authorities (and any successor bodies thereto) shall, in addition to Milton Keynes Council, be entitled to call off contracts under the framework to be procured, provided they have first sought the consent of the Council, and have entered into any access arrangements required by the Council from time to time.

"any Contracting Authorities located (or part located) within the Borough of Milton Keynes that are relevant partners of the Council, where “relevant partner” is construed in accordance with Section 6 of the Care Act 2014 (or as may be construed in accordance with any replacement or analogous Law in force from time to time)".

Justification for the Framework Agreement duration exceeding 4 years: The partnership will take time to embed, develop the services and deliver the new services and is procured under the Light Touch Regime.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The Contracting Authority shall allow a period of at least 10 days to elapse between the date of despatch of notice to economic operators, who participated in the tender, notifying them of its decision and intention to award a contract and the date on which it proposes to enter into a contract with the successful economic entity or entities.

Any economic operator who has been sent a notice of being unsuccessful may write to the Contracting Authority through ProContract, the Council’s procurement portal or at the address given below to request further information.
The Contracting Authority will, as appropriate and further having regard to applicable laws, provide any further information to the economic operator regarding its tender submission and the outcome.
The above is without prejudice to any remedies that are available to economic operators under the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 and other applicable law.
